technicalIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Locate your page's HTML <head> section
2. Add: <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
3. Save and publish your changes

For platform-specific instructions, we recommend identifying your CMS/platform and checking their documentation

technicalIssues.details: No Schema.org structured data detected across the site. Add JSON-LD or microdata to help search engines understand your content.
technicalIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Use Google's Structured Data Markup Helper to generate schema
2. Add the JSON-LD code to your page's <head> section
3. Example: <script type="application/ld+json">{...}</script>
4. Validate using Google's Structured Data Testing Tool
5. Save and publish your changes

For platform-specific instructions, we recommend identifying your CMS/platform and checking their documentation

technicalIssues.details: No Organization or Person Schema identified across the site. The absence of Identity Schema can make it harder for Search Engines and LLMs to identify the ownership of a website.
technicalIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Use Google's Structured Data Markup Helper to generate schema
2. Add the JSON-LD code to your page's <head> section
3. Example: <script type="application/ld+json">{...}</script>
4. Validate using Google's Structured Data Testing Tool
5. Save and publish your changes

For platform-specific instructions, we recommend identifying your CMS/platform and checking their documentation

technicalIssues.details: X-Frame-Options prevents clickjacking attacks. Recommended: "SAMEORIGIN" or "DENY".
technicalIssues.fixInstructions: Review the issue details and consult your web server documentation for implementation steps.

technicalIssues.details: X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff prevents MIME type sniffing attacks.
technicalIssues.fixInstructions: Review the issue details and consult your web server documentation for implementation steps.

onPageIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Locate your page's HTML <head> section
2. Add or update: <meta name="description" content="Your description here (150-160 characters)">
3. If using a CMS, check your SEO settings or page editor
4. Save and publish your changes

For platform-specific instructions, we recommend identifying your CMS/platform and checking their documentation

1. Edit your page content 2. Add exactly ONE

heading at the top of your main content 3. Example:

Your Main Heading

4. Remove any duplicate H1 tags 5. Save and publish your changes For platform-specific instructions, we recommend identifying your CMS/platform and checking their documentation

onPageIssues.details: Found on 2 pages. Each page should have a unique title tag for better SEO.
onPageIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Locate your page's HTML <head> section
2. Update the <title> tag: <title>Your Page Title (50-60 characters)</title>
3. If using a CMS, check your SEO settings or page editor
4. Save and publish your changes

For platform-specific instructions, we recommend identifying your CMS/platform and checking their documentation

4. Save and publish your changes

onPageIssues.details: Canonical tags prevent duplicate content issues. Add <link rel="canonical" href="[preferred-url]"> to the <head> section.
onPageIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Locate your page's HTML <head> section
2. Add: <link rel="canonical" href="https://yourdomain.com/page-url">
3. Use the preferred URL (usually the HTTPS version)
4. Save and publish your changes

For platform-specific instructions, we recommend identifying your CMS/platform and checking their documentation

onPageIssues.details: Headings skip levels (e.g., H1 followed by H3 without H2). Maintain proper hierarchy: H1 → H2 → H3 → H4.
onPageIssues.fixInstructions: Review the issue details and implement the recommended changes. Test changes in Google Search Console after implementation.

onPageIssues.details: Use H2 tags to structure your content and break it into logical sections.
onPageIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Use H2 tags to structure your content into sections 2. Create 3-5 H2 sections per page 3. Include related keywords in H2 tags 4. Maintain logical hierarchy: H1 → H2 → H3 5. Example structure:

Main Topic

Section 1

Section 2

Subsection 2.1

onPageIssues.details: Found on 17 pages with similar structure (likely using the same template). Each page should have a unique title tag, or use canonical tags if they're intentionally duplicate content.
onPageIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Locate your page's HTML <head> section
2. Update the <title> tag: <title>Your Page Title (50-60 characters)</title>
3. If using a CMS, check your SEO settings or page editor
4. Save and publish your changes

For platform-specific instructions, we recommend identifying your CMS/platform and checking their documentation

onPageIssues.details: Canonical URL (https://linear.app/features) differs from page URL. This is intentional if this is a duplicate page, otherwise it may indicate a configuration issue.
onPageIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Locate your page's HTML <head> section
2. Add: <link rel="canonical" href="https://yourdomain.com/page-url">
3. Use the preferred URL (usually the HTTPS version)
4. Save and publish your changes

For platform-specific instructions, we recommend identifying your CMS/platform and checking their documentation

onPageIssues.message: Primary keyword not in meta description
onPageIssues.details: Include your primary keyword "Features" in the meta description for better relevance.
onPageIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Locate your page's HTML <head> section
2. Add or update: <meta name="description" content="Your description here (150-160 characters)">
3. If using a CMS, check your SEO settings or page editor
4. Save and publish your changes

For platform-specific instructions, we recommend identifying your CMS/platform and checking their documentation

onPageIssues.details: OG title ("Features – Linear") differs from page title ("About – Linear"); OG description differs from meta description
onPageIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Locate your page's HTML <head> section
2. Add Open Graph tags:
   <meta property="og:title" content="Your Title">
   <meta property="og:description" content="Your Description">
   <meta property="og:image" content="https://yourdomain.com/image.jpg">
3. Add Twitter Card tags:
   <meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image">
4. Save and publish your changes

For platform-specific instructions, we recommend identifying your CMS/platform and checking their documentation

onPageIssues.details: Lazy loading images improves page load time. Add loading="lazy" to images below the fold.
onPageIssues.fixInstructions: 1. Add loading="lazy" attribute to images below the fold 2. Example: 3. Don't lazy load images above the fold (visible immediately) 4. For modern browsers, this is supported natively 5. Consider using a lazy loading library for older browser support

contentIssues.details: Page has only 110 words. Aim for at least 300 words for basic pages, 1000+ for comprehensive content.
contentIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Expand content to at least 300 words for basic pages
2. Aim for 1000+ words for comprehensive, authoritative content
3. Add more detail, examples, and explanations
4. Include FAQs, case studies, or related information
5. Break content into logical sections with headings
6. Add supporting images, charts, or infographics
7. Consider creating a content calendar for regular updates

contentIssues.message: Content is very difficult to read
contentIssues.details: Flesch Reading Ease score: 30. Aim for 60+ for general audiences. Simplify sentence structure and use shorter words.
contentIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Simplify sentence structure - aim for 15-20 words per sentence
2. Use shorter, more common words instead of complex vocabulary
3. Break long sentences into shorter ones
4. Use active voice instead of passive voice
5. Add transition words to connect ideas
6. Use bullet points and lists for complex information
7. Test readability using tools like Hemingway Editor
8. Aim for Flesch Reading Ease score of 60+ for general audiences

contentIssues.details: Average sentence length is 53 words. Aim for 15-20 words per sentence for better readability.
contentIssues.fixInstructions:
1. Break long sentences into shorter ones
2. Aim for 15-20 words per sentence on average
3. Remove unnecessary clauses and phrases
4. Use commas and semicolons appropriately
5. Read sentences aloud to check natural flow
6. Use sentence variety - mix short and medium sentences

accessibilityIssues.details: 27 of 27 images missing alt text (100%). This hurts accessibility and SEO.
accessibilityIssues.fixInstructions: 1. Add descriptive alt attributes to all images on affected pages 2. Describe what the image shows or its purpose (e.g., alt="Woman using laptop at desk") 3. Keep alt text concise (under 125 characters recommended) 4. For decorative images, use alt="" (empty but present) 5. Include relevant keywords naturally if the image is content-related 6. Example: 7. Don't start with "image of" or "picture of" - be direct and descriptive
